column7: * Set public url for public keycloak endpoints Signed-off-by: Anatolii Bazko <abazko@redhat.com> <!-- Please review the following before submitting a PR: Che's Contributing Guide: https://github.com/eclipse/che/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md Pull Request Policy: https://github.com/eclipse/che/wiki/Development-Workflow#pull-requests --> ### What does this PR do? Signed-off-by: Mykola Morhun <mmorhun@redhat.com> ### What does this PR do? Backports https://github.com/eclipse/che/pull/18651 into `7.23.x` branch ### What issues does this PR fix or reference? https://github.com/eclipse/che/issues/18648 ### How to test this PR? Deploy Eclipse Che using helm installer: `chectl server:deploy --installer=helm --platform=<platform>` ::

### What does this PR do? Fix che-server when used external oidc provider. ### What issues does this PR fix or reference? https://github.com/eclipse/che/issues/18553 ### How to test this PR? <!-- Please explain for example : - Signed-off-by: Oleksandr Andriienko <oandriie@redhat.com> ::can we extract it to the `private String getInfoEnpoint();`::can we extract it to the `private String getjwksUriEndpoint()`; Also, tests will be much appreciated ;-) ::@ibuziuk @AndrienkoAleksandr is on PTO today. He will take a look tomorrow.::ok, thanks - I'm ok if we merge it in the current state as an exception, otherwise, we can have a fix backported to `7.23.x` and wait for `7.23.1` for Hosted Che update (currently this is a blocker for the latest version rollout)::what about having a static builder method that can be reused from KeycloakSettings constructor? ::What about `JWKS_URI`->`jwksUri`?::javadoc?::is it lib already defined in https://github.com/eclipse/che-parent/blob/master/pom.xml ? CQ approved etc?::deps moved from che-parent https://github.com/eclipse/che/blob/master/pom.xml. This build and test-lib already has a cq in Eclipse db (https://dev.eclipse.org/ipzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=20192) and according to the latest simplification of process, we don't need to create a PB cq for it.::Should be  `@Inject` ?::Should be `@Singleton` ?::sorry, I'm not following why are you changing the method signature and what is the `REALM_SETTING`, we do not have this setup on Hosted Che::what is this new env var about and how is it documented?::keycloakSettings put in the map `realm` from this variable, so we could inject it directly. But ok, I will revert this change, that's not necessary.::well, we can live if it is needed, but I suppose it will be null in Hosted Che case ::@AndrienkoAleksandr looks like you forced pushed smth. unexpected ;-)::Thanks, I removed. Sorry I did force push because I re-based code to the latest master. Maybe it was a bad idea.::That's known property. But if realm is null on the hosted Che, then I  think `remove user` feature will be broken when this feature is enabled...  I see that realm is required for https://github.com/eclipse/che/blob/7.23.x/multiuser/keycloak/che-multiuser-keycloak-user-remover/src/main/java/org/eclipse/che/multiuser/keycloak/server/KeycloakUserRemover.java#L89. But maybe it's not an issue if hosted Che doesn't supports this feature at all.::I removed this change. I guess I shouldn't do over refactoring.::

### What does this PR do? Forces to use sources compatible with java8 and runtime java 11. In case of java 8 runtime ``` [INFO] [INFO] --- maven-enforcer-plugin:3.0.0-M2:enforce (enforce-java-version) @ che-parent --- [WARNING] Rule 0: org.apache.maven.plugins.enforcer.RequireJavaVersion failed with message: To build this project JDK 11 (or upper) is required. Please install it. Since we might need to backport some feature for old branches it would be nice to keep source code in master java 8 compatible for some time ::
